turns.content: Write an itinerary for a 3 day trip to New York City include 2 restaurant suggestions for each meal of the day. Choose restaurants that are popular on Yelp or on Eater NY or the New York Times. Include 3 activities for each day and provide directions for transportation by subway.

Day 1:

Breakfast:

1. Russ & Daughters Cafe (Lower East Side) - Try their bagels with lox, cream cheese and capers
2. Clinton St. Baking Company (Lower East Side) - Try their fluffy pancakes or eggs benedict

Activities:

1. Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island Tour - Take the subway to Bowling Green (4,5) and take the Statue of Liberty Ferry from Battery Park.
2. 9/11 Memorial & Museum - Take the subway to World Trade Center (E)
3. Central Park - Take the subway to 59th St - Columbus Circle (A,B,C,D)

Lunch:

1. Prince Street Pizza (Soho) - Try their famous pepperoni slice
2. Xi'an Famous Foods (Various locations) - Try their hand-pulled noodles

Dinner:

1. Peter Luger Steak House (Brooklyn) - Try their signature porterhouse steak
2. Carbone (Greenwich Village) - Try their rigatoni alla vodka or veal parmesan

Day 2:

Breakfast:

1. The Smith (Various locations) - Try their avocado toast or eggs benedict
2. Sarabeth's (Central Park South) - Try their lemon ricotta pancakes or eggs florentine

Activities:

1. The Metropolitan Museum of Art - Take the subway to 86th St (4,5,6)
2. Brooklyn Bridge & DUMBO - Take the subway to Brooklyn Bridge - City Hall (4,5,6) and walk across the bridge to DUMBO.
3. Broadway Show - Take the subway to Times Square - 42nd St (N,Q,R,W,1,2,3,7,S)

Lunch:

1. Shake Shack (Various locations) - Try their classic ShackBurger
2. Los Tacos No. 1 (Chelsea Market) - Try their adobada tacos or quesadillas

Dinner:

1. Le Bernardin (Midtown West) - Try their seafood tasting menu
2. Babbo (Greenwich Village) - Try their pasta tasting menu

Day 3:

Breakfast:

1. Buvette (West Village) - Try their croissants or waffles
2. Joe's Pizza (Greenwich Village) - Try their classic cheese slice

Activities:

1. Empire State Building - Take the subway to 34th St - Herald Square (B,D,F,M,N,Q,R,W)
2. High Line & Chelsea Market - Take the subway to 14th St (A,C,E,L) and walk to the High Line.
3. Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) - Take the subway to 5th Ave - 53rd St (E,M)

Lunch:

1. Katz's Delicatessen (Lower East Side) - Try their pastrami sandwich or matzo ball soup
2. Artichoke Basille's Pizza (Various locations) - Try their artichoke pizza

Dinner:

1. Eleven Madison Park (Flatiron District) - Try their tasting menu
2. Momofuku Noodle Bar (East Village) - Try their pork buns or ramen

Transportation:
The best way to navigate New York City is through its subway system. You can buy a MetroCard at any subway station, which can be used for both the subway and the bus. Google Maps or the MTA website can help you plan your route.
Write a list of 10 restaurants in Brooklyn that are trendy and new.

Here are 10 trendy and new restaurants in Brooklyn that are worth checking out:

1. Olmsted (Prospect Heights) - Seasonal American cuisine with a focus on locally sourced ingredients and creative presentation.
2. Win Son Bakery (East Williamsburg) - Taiwanese-American bakery serving up unique pastries, sandwiches, and coffee.
3. Llama Inn (Williamsburg) - Peruvian-inspired dishes with a modern twist, including ceviches, grilled meats, and inventive cocktails.
4. Di An Di (Greenpoint) - Vietnamese restaurant with a focus on fresh, vibrant flavors and an impressive cocktail program.
5. Faun (Prospect Heights) - Rustic Italian cuisine with a focus on seasonal, locally sourced ingredients and house-made pastas.
6. Ops Pizza (Bushwick) - Wood-fired Neapolitan-style pizzas made with natural sourdough and topped with locally sourced ingredients.
7. Misi (Williamsburg) - Modern Italian cuisine with a focus on handmade pastas and seasonal vegetables.
8. Maison Yaki (Prospect Heights) - French-Japanese fusion restaurant with a focus on grilled skewers and small plates.
9. Gertie (Williamsburg) - Modern Jewish deli serving up classic dishes with a twist, along with house-made pastries and coffee.
10. Oxalis (Prospect Heights) - Contemporary French cuisine with a focus on seasonal, locally sourced ingredients and a rotating tasting menu.
Write a list of 5 hole in the wall restaurants in Manhattan that have excellent food.

Here are 5 hole in the wall restaurants in Manhattan that have excellent food:

1. Xi'an Famous Foods (Multiple Locations) - This small chain of noodle shops specializes in spicy, hand-pulled noodles and other regional Chinese specialties.
2. Mamouns (Greenwich Village) - This family-owned Middle Eastern restaurant has been serving up delicious falafel, shawarma, and other Middle Eastern dishes since 1971.
3. Joe's Pizza (Greenwich Village) - A classic New York pizzeria that has been serving up some of the city's best slices since 1975.
4. Totto Ramen (Multiple Locations) - This tiny ramen shop serves up some of the best bowls of noodles in the city, with rich, flavorful broth and perfectly cooked noodles.
5. Sophie's Cuban Cuisine (Multiple Locations) - This unassuming Cuban restaurant serves up delicious and authentic dishes like lechon asado, arroz con pollo, and empanadas.
Write a list of 5 hole in the wall restaurants in San Francisco that have excellent food.
